items.title: Spot Prices Wrap: Natural Gas Cash Average Ekes Out Gain as Market Stabilizes
items.summary: Following five straight days of losses, physical natural gas prices increased overall on Tuesday, but varied widely by region.

items.title: Eastern Mediterranean Expansion Underpins Chevron’s Growing Global Natural Gas Portfolio
items.summary: Chevron Corp. is expanding its natural gas footprint in the Eastern Mediterranean as the globe’s thirst for the fuel continues to grow.

items.title: Caturus Inches Commonwealth LNG Toward FID With Mercuria Offtake, Gas Supply Pacts
items.summary: Caturus Energy LLC has secured more than 70% of offtake from the first phase of its proposed Commonwealth LNG project and a natural gas supplier under a long-term agreement with the trading arm of Mercuria Energy Group Ltd.

items.title: Futures Settle: Unimpressive Forecasts Limit Natural Gas Gains
items.summary: After plunging more than 25% in a single session to start the week amid bearish forecast trends, prompt month natural gas futures reversed course modestly on Tuesday.

items.title: ANR Pipeline Maintenance Expected to Curb U.S. LNG Feed Gas Deliveries This Week
items.summary: ANR Pipeline Co. on Tuesday kicked off a five-day stretch of maintenance that’s expected to reduce feed gas deliveries to the Calcasieu Pass LNG export terminal in Louisiana.

items.title: MidDay Snapshot: Cold in East Halts Losing Streak for Natural Gas Cash Prices
items.summary: Spot natural gas prices were mostly in an uptrend at midday Tuesday, putting NGI’s Spot Gas National Avg. on track toward breaking a five-session losing streak.

items.title: MidDay Futures: Thursday’s Storage Outlook Clears Path for Natural Gas Bulls
items.summary: March natural gas futures edged higher into midday Tuesday as bears moved to the sidelines ahead of a potentially outsized storage withdrawal due Thursday that could interrupt the market’s warm weather-driven sell-off.

items.title: Midmorning Markets: Record Bidweek Natural Gas Prices Amplify Mother Nature’s Prominence
items.summary: Natural gas cash prices soared in February bidweek trading, with bulls invigorated by frigid cold blasts that permeated the nation’s midsection and much of the East late last month.

items.title: Lingering Freeze Warnings Push Florida Natural Gas Markets Back Up
items.summary: Persistent cold over the Southeast is sending natural gas flows and regional prices in Florida upward again, despite a warmer outlook in the coming week.

items.title: Trump Moves to Re-Engage on Africa’s Most Contested Power Project
items.summary: U.S. President Donald Trump has offered to mediate a long-running dispute between Egypt and Ethiopia over the latter’s construction of a giant dam on the Nile. According to the experts, Trump attempted to broker a deal over the dam during his first t

items.title: Why Western Oil Majors Are Willing to Take the Libya Risk Again
items.summary: With Russia still focused on Ukraine and China on Taiwan, the U.S. and its key Western allies -- most notably, Great Britain, France, and Italy -- are continuing to secure highly strategic geopolitical gains across the Middle East and North Africa (M

items.title: $60 Oil Forces Europe’s Energy Giants to Rethink Buybacks
items.summary: The oil price decline over the past year has started to dent Big Oil’s earnings, which have slipped from the 2022 and 2023 highs. The persistently low oil prices at about $60 per barrel in the past months, compared to $100 in 2022 and $80 in 2023 and

items.title: Global Climate Tax Plan Puts Big Oil in the Crosshairs
items.summary: The United Nations is discussing a new international tax collection cooperation regime that, among other things, aims to extract money from the oil and gas industry for climate change. It is not the first attempt to make the industry pay, and it will

items.title: US Crude Oil Inventories Take Big Hits In Storm Aftermath
items.summary: The American Petroleum Institute (API) estimated that crude oil inventories in the United States decreased by 11.1 million barrels in the week ending January 30. Crude oil inventories decreased by 247,000 barrels in the week prior. Inventories in the

items.title: Washington Prepares Broad License to Restart Venezuelan Oil Production
items.summary: Washington is preparing to take another step deeper into Venezuela’s oil sector, with plans to issue a broad license that would allow companies to pump crude in the country for the first time in years. According to people familiar with the matter who
